Views¶

Here are the functions for the views

class JSONResponse(HttpResponse):¶

An HttpResponse that renders its content into JSON.

Functions

__init__(self, data, **kwargs):

Constructor for string operations

Parameters:
  • data – data to render for JSON
  • kwargs – keyword arguments
user_list(request):

List all users, or create a new user.

Parameters:request – HttpRequest , Get or Post
Returns:JSONResponse(serializer,data)
Returns:JSONResponse(serializer.data, status=201)
Returns:JSONResponse(serializer.errors, status=400)
user_detail(request, pk):

Retrieve, update or delete userdata.

Parameters:
  • request – User data
  • pk – Primary Key of the User
Returns:

HttpResponse(status=404) = error
Returns:

JSONResponse(serializer.data) = accept
Returns:

JSONResponse(serializer.errors, status=400) = error
Returns:

return HttpResponse(status=204) = accept
auth_check(request):

Checks the authentication.

Parameters:request – Userdata for authentification
Returns:JSONResponse(content) = auth. failt or passed
Returns:HttpResponse(status=404) = Error
user_login(request):

Checks datas from login page and gives ja session-id

Parameters:request – Userdata from login
Returns:session-id
user_logout(request):

Logs the user out and deletes the session

Parameters:request – Logout action
Returns:reload with passed message

Show the home screen.

Parameters:request – Request for entering homescreen
Returns:render homescreen

Parameters:request – Request for entering Profile
Returns:render Profilescreen - if accept
Returns:render Login - if no session-id

Parameters:request – Request for the Registration-view
Returns:render Registration - if accept
